APx.caption: layout
APx.doc: an object specifying the way participantsâ€™ videos are laid out in the live stream.
APx.name: layout

APy.caption: user id
APy.doc: If using the single-participant layout, specify the user id of the participant that the single participant layout should focus on. You can set a user id with the daily - create meeting token action.
APy.name: user_id

AQA.caption: If using the single-participant layout, specify the user id of the single participant. Set a user id with the Daily - create meeting token action.
AQA.name: singleParticipantInfo

AQB.caption: Starts a recording. This is a pay-as-you-go feature and requires a credit card in your Daily account
AQB.name: scaleplanonly

AQK.caption: max streams
AQK.doc: Specify the number of max streams in the recording (from 1-9). The default value is 9.
AQK.name: maxstreams

AQM.caption: If using the portrait layout, you can specify the variant. The default is vertical which will display the call grid style. Inset will have one participant's video take up the entire screen and the other in a smaller rectangle.
AQM.name: portraitinfo

ARO.caption: height
ARO.doc: Specified to control the resolution of the live stream. The value must be even, i.e., a multiple of 2.
ARO.name: heightRecording

ARP.caption: width
ARP.doc: Specified to control the resolution of the live stream. The value must be even, i.e., a multiple of 2
ARP.name: widthRecording

ARQ.caption: background color
ARQ.doc: Specifies the background color of the stream, formatted as #rrggbb or #aarrggbb string.
ARQ.name: backgroundColor

ARR.caption: video bitrate
ARR.doc: Specifies the video bitrate in kilobits per second (kbps) to use for video output. Value can range between 10 and 10000
ARR.name: videoBitrate

ARS.caption: audio bitrate
ARS.doc: Specifies the audio bitrate in kilobits per second (kbps) to use for audio output. Value can range between 10 and 320
ARS.name: audioBitrate

ART.caption: Below are optional advanced recording settings to further configure the recording experience.
ART.name: advanced_settings

ARV.caption: min Idle time out
ARV.doc: Amount of time in seconds to wait before ending a recording or live stream when the room is idle (e.g. when all users have muted video and audio).
ARV.name: minIdleTimeOut

ARW.caption: max duration
ARW.doc: maximum duration in seconds after which recording/streaming is forcefully stopped. Defaults: 10800 seconds (3 hours) for recordings
ARW.name: maxDuration
